alert.note: Alert for Todd (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 7:06PM EDT until August 10 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Kentucky, including the following county, Todd. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 604 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Radar estimates between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional locally heavy rain that repeats over these same saturated grounds are expected to result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elkton, Clarksville, Guthrie, Trenton, Allegre, Justice, Allensville and Clifty.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
